title: Long-term outcomes of second-generation drug-eluting stents in complex coronary lesions: 5-year follow-up
search_strategy: PubMed: coronary stent AND drug-eluting AND long-term outcomes
summary: 5-year follow-up of 2800 patients showing sustained safety and efficacy of sirolimus-eluting stents with TLR rate of 4.2% and definite/probable stent thrombosis rate of 0.8%

title: Polymer degradation in bioabsorbable-coated coronary stents: systematic review and meta-analysis
search_strategy: PubMed: bioabsorbable polymer AND coronary stent AND degradation
summary: Meta-analysis of 12 studies confirming complete polymer resorption within 12-18 months with no evidence of chronic inflammatory response; supports safety of bioabsorbable coatings

title: Impact of stent platform material on clinical outcomes: cobalt-chromium vs platinum-chromium
search_strategy: PubMed: cobalt chromium stent AND clinical outcomes
summary: Comparative study finding no significant difference in MACE between CoCr and PtCr platforms at 3-year follow-up (HR 0.97; 95% CI 0.82-1.14)

title: DAPT duration after DES implantation in stable coronary artery disease: updated evidence
search_strategy: PubMed: dual antiplatelet therapy AND drug-eluting stent AND duration
summary: RCT demonstrating non-inferiority of 3-month vs 12-month DAPT in stable CAD patients receiving current-generation DES with polymer coating

title: Real-world safety surveillance of coronary stents: analysis of the EU vigilance database 2019-2022
search_strategy: PubMed: coronary stent AND vigilance AND Europe AND safety
summary: Analysis of 15000+ vigilance reports showing stable safety profile for current-generation DES; serious incident rate 0.12% consistent with pre-market estimates

title: Nickel allergy and coronary stent outcomes: a prospective cohort study
search_strategy: PubMed: nickel allergy AND coronary stent AND clinical outcome
summary: Prospective study of 450 patients with known nickel sensitivity receiving CoCr stents showing no increased rate of adverse clinical events compared to non-allergic controls

title: Catheter delivery system failures in complex PCI: a single-center experience
search_strategy: PubMed: catheter delivery AND coronary stent AND failure
summary: Single-center review of 1200 PCI procedures showing 1.8% rate of delivery-related procedural difficulty; risk factors include vessel tortuosity and calcification

title: Late and very late stent thrombosis with contemporary DES: 10-year registry data
search_strategy: PubMed: late stent thrombosis AND drug-eluting stent AND registry
summary: Registry of 8500 patients showing cumulative late/very late ST rate of 1.2% at 10 years; comparable across current-generation DES platforms

title: Stent fracture detection and clinical consequences: updated systematic review
search_strategy: PubMed: stent fracture AND coronary AND clinical outcome
summary: Systematic review of 28 studies; overall stent fracture rate 2.6% with clinical significance (TLR) in 15% of fracture cases; CoCr platforms show lower fracture rates than stainless steel

title: Post-market clinical follow-up requirements for coronary stents under EU MDR: a practical guide
search_strategy: PubMed: EU MDR AND coronary stent AND PMCF
summary: Guidance paper on PMCF study design for coronary stents under EU MDR; supports registry-based approach for Class IIb/III devices

title: Drug-eluting stent performance in diabetic patients: contemporary evidence
search_strategy: PubMed: drug-eluting stent AND diabetes AND outcomes
summary: Study focused on insulin-dependent diabetes subgroup with specific limus-free platforms; not directly applicable to CardioStent-X population

title: Bioresorbable vs durable polymer DES: 5-year network meta-analysis
search_strategy: PubMed: bioresorbable polymer AND durable polymer AND drug-eluting stent AND meta-analysis
summary: Network meta-analysis of 45 RCTs showing no significant difference in MACE between bioresorbable and durable polymer DES at 5 years; slight advantage in very late ST for bioresorbable (OR 0.78; 95% CI 0.62-0.98)
